summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from September 2019 discussing victim compensation applications for Epstein victims. The emails show FBI personnel in New York and the Victim Services Division coordinating to obtain a prosecutorial letter from the SDNY to support victim claims, with one agent expressing anger about 'what happened over the weekend' (likely referencing Epstein's death).

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who could push a request to the SDNY regarding victim compensation letters for Epstein victims.

persons.name: Cronin
persons.role: OVS (Office for Victims of Crime) representative
persons.context: Responds to an FBI inquiry about victim compensation, stating that a letter from a DA or AUSA confirming they would have prosecuted if timely could allow coverage, and expresses anger about recent events.

connections.description: Indirect professional connection through email chain discussing victim compensation procedures for Epstein victims, with Mike suggested to push a request to SDNY that aligns with Cronin's guidance.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced indirectly by Cronin's statement 'I'm so angry about what happened over the weekend,' which aligns with the timing of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Inquiry about victim compensation
events.description: An FBI agent emails Cronin at OVS asking if Epstein victims can still apply for compensation since they only recently disclosed their abuse.

events.title: FBI internal coordination on victim letter
events.description: Series of internal FBI emails forwarding a request to have Mike push the SDNY for a prosecutorial letter needed for victim compensation applications.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively working on victim compensation applications for Epstein victims in the NYC area as of September 2019.
The Office for Victims of Crime indicated a letter from a DA or AUSA stating they would have prosecuted if the case was brought timely could enable victim compensation.
An OVS representative expressed anger about 'what happened over the weekend' in August 2019, a clear reference to Epstein's death.
Internal FBI emails show coordination between the New York Field Office and the FBI Victim Services Division to obtain necessary documentation from the SDNY.
